00006 // =============================================================================
00007 // Name   : teleop_arm_key.cpp
00008 // Author : Jonathan Hasenzahl
00009 // Date   : 2012
00010 //
00011 // Implements the ROS node "teleop_arm_key". This node accepts keyboard input to
00012 // pass commands to the "arm_control" node. The code used for getting input from
00013 // the keyboard was originally found in teleop_turtle_key.cpp inside the
00014 // "turtlesim" package on ros.org.
00015 // =============================================================================
00016 
00017 #include "arm/teleop_arm_key.h"
00018 #include "arm/movement_definitions.h"
00019 #include <signal.h>
00020 #include <termios.h>
00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 
00023 int kfd = 0;
00024 struct termios cooked, raw;
00025 
00031 TeleopArmKey::TeleopArmKey()
00032 {
00033     cmd_pub_ = n_.advertise<arm::constant_move>("constant_moves", 1);
00034     cmd_.states.fill(0);
00035     cmd_.speeds.fill(0);
00036     cmd_.query = false;
00037     cmd_.quit = false;
00038     init();
00039 }
00040 
00047 void TeleopArmKey::init()
00048 {
00049     // Wait for a subscriber to "constant_moves" before continuing
00050     ROS_INFO("Waiting for subscriber...");
00051     while (cmd_pub_.getNumSubscribers() < 1 && ros::ok());
00052     keyLoop();
00053 }
00054 
00058 void TeleopArmKey::keyLoop()
00059 {
00060     // Get the console in raw mode
00061     tcgetattr(kfd, &cooked);
00062     memcpy(&raw, &cooked, sizeof(struct termios));
00063     raw.c_lflag &=~ (ICANON | ECHO);
00064     
00065     // Setting a new line, then end of file                         
00066     raw.c_cc[VEOL] = 1;
00067     raw.c_cc[VEOF] = 2;
00068     tcsetattr(kfd, TCSANOW, &raw);
00069 
00070     printf("\nNow reading from the keyboard.\n");
00071     printf("Use the keyboard to move the ARM.\n");
00072     printf("Take care not to exceed its range of motion!\n");
00073     
00074     char input;
00075     bool shutdown = false;
00076     bool new_command = false;
00077 
00078     // Continue only while shutdown flag has not been enabled and there is still
00079     // a subscriber to receive messages
00080     while (!shutdown && cmd_pub_.getNumSubscribers() > 0 && ros::ok())
00081     {
00082         // Get the next event from the keyboard  
00083         if(read(kfd, &input, 1) < 0)
00084         {
00085             perror("read():");
00086             exit(-1);
00087         }
00088       
00089         //printf("Key value: 0x%02X\n", input);
00090         new_command = getCommand(input);
00091       
00092         if (new_command)
00093         {
00094             cmd_pub_.publish(cmd_);
00095 
00096             if (cmd_.query)
00097                 cmd_.query = false;
00098             if (cmd_.quit)
00099                 shutdown = true;
00100 
00101             new_command = false;
00102         }
00103     }
00104 }
00105 
00111 bool TeleopArmKey::getCommand(const char c)
00112 {
00113     bool new_command = true;
00114     switch (c)
00115     {
00116     case KEYCODE_BACKSPACE:
00117         cmd_.states.fill(0);
00118         cmd_.speeds.fill(0);
00119         break;
00120 
00121     // Arm control
00122     case KEYCODE_W:
00123         cmd_.states[X] = cmd_.states[X] == ARM_FORWARD ? STOP :
00124                              ARM_FORWARD;
00125         break;
00126     case KEYCODE_A:
00127         cmd_.states[Y] = cmd_.states[Y] == ARM_LEFT ? STOP : ARM_LEFT;
00128         break;
00129     case KEYCODE_S:
00130         cmd_.states[X] = cmd_.states[X] == ARM_BACKWARD ? STOP :
00131                              ARM_BACKWARD;
00132         break;
00133     case KEYCODE_D:
00134         cmd_.states[Y] = cmd_.states[Y] == ARM_RIGHT ? STOP : ARM_RIGHT;
00135         break;
00136     case KEYCODE_Z:
00137         cmd_.states[Z] = cmd_.states[Z] == ARM_UP ? STOP : ARM_UP;
00138         break;
00139     case KEYCODE_X:
00140         cmd_.states[Z] = cmd_.states[Z] == ARM_DOWN ? STOP : ARM_DOWN;
00141         break;
00142     case KEYCODE_F:
00143         // Fold: not implemented
00144         new_command = false;
00145         break;
00146     case KEYCODE_U:
00147         // Unfold: not implemented
00148         new_command = false;
00149         break;
00150     
00151     // Claw control     
00152     case KEYCODE_NUM_4:
00153         cmd_.states[YAW] = cmd_.states[YAW] == CLAW_YAW_LEFT ? STOP :
00154                                 CLAW_YAW_LEFT;
00155         break;
00156     case KEYCODE_NUM_6:
00157         cmd_.states[YAW] = cmd_.states[YAW] == CLAW_YAW_RIGHT ? STOP :
00158                                 CLAW_YAW_RIGHT;
00159         break;
00160     case KEYCODE_NUM_8:
00161         cmd_.states[PITCH] = cmd_.states[PITCH] == CLAW_PITCH_UP ?
00162                                   STOP : CLAW_PITCH_UP;
00163         break;
00164     case KEYCODE_NUM_2:
00165         cmd_.states[PITCH] = cmd_.states[PITCH] == CLAW_PITCH_DOWN ?
00166                                   STOP : CLAW_PITCH_DOWN;
00167         break;
00168     case KEYCODE_NUM_7:
00169         cmd_.states[ROLL] = cmd_.states[ROLL] == CLAW_ROLL_LEFT ?
00170                                  STOP : CLAW_ROLL_LEFT;
00171         break;
00172     case KEYCODE_NUM_9:
00173         cmd_.states[ROLL] = cmd_.states[ROLL] == CLAW_ROLL_RIGHT ?
00174                                  STOP : CLAW_ROLL_RIGHT;
00175         break;
00176     case KEYCODE_NUM_MINUS:
00177         cmd_.states[GRIP] = cmd_.states[GRIP] == CLAW_GRIP_CLOSE ?
00178                                  STOP : CLAW_GRIP_CLOSE;
00179         break;
00180     case KEYCODE_NUM_PLUS:
00181         cmd_.states[GRIP] = cmd_.states[GRIP] == CLAW_GRIP_OPEN ?
00182                                  STOP : CLAW_GRIP_OPEN;
00183         break;
00184     
00185     // Lift control    
00186     case KEYCODE_UP:
00187         cmd_.states[LIFT] = cmd_.states[LIFT] == LIFT_UP ? STOP :
00188                                  LIFT_UP;
00189         break;
00190     case KEYCODE_DOWN:
00191         cmd_.states[LIFT] = cmd_.states[LIFT] == LIFT_DOWN ? STOP :
00192                                  LIFT_DOWN;
00193         break;
00194        
00195     // Other
00196     case KEYCODE_COMMA:
00197         // Currently affects all speeds at once
00198         if (cmd_.speeds[0] > 0)
00199         {
00200             for (int i = 0; i < SPD_ARR_SZ; i++)
00201                 cmd_.speeds[i]--;
00202         }
00203         else
00204             new_command = false;
00205 
00206         printf("Speed[%d]\n", cmd_.speeds[0]);
00207         break;
00208     case KEYCODE_PERIOD:
00209         // Currently affects all speeds at once
00210         if (cmd_.speeds[0] < 4)
00211         {
00212             for (int i = 0; i < SPD_ARR_SZ; i++)
00213                 cmd_.speeds[i]++;
00214         }
00215         else
00216             new_command = false;
00217 
00218         printf("Speed[%d]\n", cmd_.speeds[0]);
00219         break;
00220     case KEYCODE_TAB:
00221         print();
00222         cmd_.query = true;
00223         break;
00224     case KEYCODE_Q:
00225         cmd_.states.fill(0);
00226         cmd_.quit = true;
00227         break;
00228     default:
00229         new_command = false;
00230         break;
00231     }
00232 
00233     return new_command;
00234 }
00235 
00239 void TeleopArmKey::print()
00240 {
00241     printf("\nX[%d] Y[%d] Z[%d]\n", cmd_.states[1], cmd_.states[2],
00242            cmd_.states[0]);
00243     printf("Yaw[%d] Pitch[%d] Roll[%d] Grip[%d]\n", cmd_.states[3],
00244            cmd_.states[4], cmd_.states[5], cmd_.states[6]);
00245     printf("Lift[%d] Speed[%d]\n", cmd_.states[7], cmd_.speeds[0]);
00246 }
00247 
00251 void quit(int sig)
00252 {
00253     tcsetattr(kfd, TCSANOW, &cooked);
00254     exit(0);
00255 }
00256 
00260 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00261 {
00262     signal(SIGINT, quit);
00263     
00264     ros::init(argc, argv, "teleop_arm_key");
00265     TeleopArmKey teleop_arm_key;
00266     ros::shutdown(); // To allow arm_control node to shutdown
00267     return 0;
00268 }
